sen.j: 渡来人の豪族秦氏がヤマト王権に税を納める際、用いた絹が「うずたかくつもられた」ことから、朝廷から「うずまさ」の姓を与えられ、これに「太秦」の漢字表記を当てたという説。
sen.e: One theory is that the imperial court gave the surname of "Uzumasa" with kanji characters of a phonetic meaning of silk cloth to powerful family Hata clan, who originally came from Korea or China, because the silk clothes they paid as taxes to the Yamato Dynasty were piled in a great heap.
